title: Designing Concept Change Assessment Methods: Advanced Strategies for Elementary Social Studies Education

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary education core theories, basic social science concepts, and foundational assessment design knowledge
context.additional_context: A course focusing on designing assessment methods that apply conceptual change theory to actual elementary social studies education, primarily structured around asynchronous discussions, case analyses, and practical assignments using an LMS

learning_goals: Learners can classify three or more misconception patterns in elementary social studies based on conceptual change theory.
Learners can design one conceptual change assessment tool applying prototype-probabilistic models and case-based approaches.
Learners can develop formative assessment rubrics analyzing learners' concept usage patterns and apply them to actual classroom contexts.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
